bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related From The Messenger Of Allah (saws) About 'There Is No Vowing For Disobedience'
hadithText: Narrated 'Aishah: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "There is no vowing for disobedience, and its atonement is the atonement of an oath."
comments:
[He said:] There are narrations on this topic from Ibn 'Umar, Jabir, and Imran bin Husain.

[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is not correct, because Az-Zuhri did not hear this Hadith from Abu Salamah.

[He said:] I heard Muhammad saying: "It has been reported by more than one narrator - among them - Musa bin 'Uqbah, and Ibn Abi 'Atiq, from Az-Zuhri: 'from Sulaiman bin Arqam, from Yahya bin Abi Kathir, from Abu Salamah, from 'Aishah, from the Prophet (saws).'" Muhammad said: "And this is the Hadith."

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related From The Messenger Of Allah (saws) About 'There Is No Vowing For Disobedience'
hadithText: Narrated 'Aishah: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "There is no vowing in disobedience to Allah, and its atonement is the atonement of an oath."
comments:
[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib, and it more correct than the previous narration of Abu Safwan from Yunus. Abu Safwan is from Makkah and his name is 'Abdullah bin Sa'eed bin 'Abdul-Malik bin Marwan. Al-Humaidi and more than one of the esteemed people of Hadith reported from him.

There are those among the people of knowledge from the Companions of the Prophet (saws) and others who said: "There is no vowing of disobedience to Allah, and its atonement is the atonement of an oath." This is the view of Ahmad and Ishaq and they used the Hadith of Az-Zuhri from Abu Salamah from 'Aishah as proof.

Some of the people of knowledge among the Companions of the Prophet (saws) and others said that there is no vowing for disobedience, and that there is no atonement for that. This is the view of Malik and Ash-Shafi'i.

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: Whoever Vows To Obey Allah, Then He Should Obey Him
hadithText: Narrated 'Aishah: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Whoever vowed to obey Allah, then he should obey Him. And whoever vowed to disobey Allah, then he should not disobey Him."

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: Whoever Vows To Obey Allah, Then He Should Obey Him
hadithText: Another Chain with similar meanings.
comments:
[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. Yahya bin Abu Kathir reported it from Al-Qasim bin Muhammad.

It is the view of some of the people of knowledge among the Companions of Prophet (saws) and others. It is saying of Malik, and Ash-Shafi'i. They said: He should not disobey Allah, and there is no atonement of an oath when his vow was for disobedience.

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related About There Is No Vowing In That Over Which The Son Of Adam Has No Control
hadithText: Narrated Thabit bin Adh-Dahhak: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "It is not for a person to vow about that over which he has no control."
comments:
[He said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Abdullah bin 'Amr and 'Imran bin Husain.

[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related About Atonement For A Vow When It Was Not Specified
hadithText: Narrated 'Uqbah bin 'Amir: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "The atonement of a vow when it is not specified is the atonement of an oath."
comments: [Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih Gharib.

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related About Whoever Takes An Oath And Then Sees That Something Else Is Better Than It
hadithText: Narrated 'Abdur-Rahman bin Samurah: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "O 'Abdur-Rahman! Do not ask for a position of leadership, for if you receive it due to asking, you will be left alone with it, and if you receive it without asking, then you will be aided in it. And if you take an oath and you see that something else is better than it, then do what is better, and make an atonement for your oath."
comments:
There are narrations on this topic from 'Ali, Jabir, 'Adi bin Hatim, Abu Ad-Darda, Anas, 'Aishah, 'Abdullah bin Amr, Abu Hurairah, Umm Salamah, and Abu Musa

[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of 'Abdur-Rahman bin Samurah is a Hasan Sahih Hadith.

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related About The Atonement Before The Violation
hadithText: Narrated Abu Hurairah: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Whoever takes an oath, and then he sees that something else is better than it, then he should make atonement for his oath and then do it."
comments:
[He said:] There are narrations on this topic from Umm Salamah.

[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Abu Hurairah is a Hasan Sahih Hadith. This is acted upon according to most of the people of knowledge among the Companions of the Prophet (saws) and others. Atonement before the violation is acceptable. This is the view of Malik bin Anas, Ash-Shafi'i, Ahmad and Ishaq.

Some of the people of knowledge said that there is no atonement until after the violation. Sufyan Ath-Thawri said: "If he atones after the violation it is better to me, and if he atones before the violation it is acceptable."

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related About Making Exceptions In Oath
hadithText: Narrated Ibn 'Umar: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever swears about an oath and says: 'If Allah wills (Insha Allah), then there is no breaking of the oath against him."
comments:
[He said:] There is something on this topic from Abu Hurairah.

[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar is a Hasan Hadith. 'Ubaidullah bin 'Umar and others reported it from Nafi', from Ibn 'Umar as a Mawquf narration. Similarly, Salim reported it from Ibn 'Umar as a Mawquf narration. We do not know of anyone who narrated it in Marfu' form except from Ayyub As-Sakhtiyani. Ismail bin Ibrahim said: "Sometimes Ayyub narrated it as Marfu' and sometime he did not narrate it as Marfu'."

This is acted upon according to most of the people of knowledge among the Companions of the Prophet (saws) and others regarding making an exception when connecting it to an oath, then one will not be guilty of having broken the oath. This is the view of Sufyan Ath-Thawri, Al-Awza'i, Malik bin Anas, 'Abdullah bin Al-Mubarak, Ash-Shafi'i, Ahmad and Ishaq.

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Had Been Related About Making Exceptions In Oaths
hadithText: Narrated Abu Hurairah: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever swears [about an oath] and says: 'If Allah wills (Insha Allah), then he will not have broken it."
comments:
[Abu 'Eisa said:] I asked Muhammad bin Isma'il about this Hadith, so he said: "This Hadith is a mistake, 'Abdur-Razzaq made the mistake of abbreviating it from the narration of Ma'mar, from Ibn Tawus, from his father, from Abu Hurairah, from the Prophet (saws) who said: 'Indeed Sulaiman bin Dawud, peace be upon him, said: "Tonight I will sleep with seventy women, each woman giving birth to a boy." So he slept with them, but no one woman among them gave birth except for a woman who gave birth to half a boy.' So the Messenger of Allah (saws) said: "If Allah wills" (Insha Allah) then it would have been as he said.'" This is how it was reported from 'Abdur-Razzaq, from Ma'mar, from Ibn Tawus, from his father with this Hadith in its entirety and he said: "Seventy women."

This Hadith has been reported through more than one route from Abu Hurairah, from the Prophet (saw), that he said: "Sulaiman bin Dawud said: 'Tonight I shall sleep with one hundred women.'"

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related About It being Disliked To Swear By Other Than Allah
hadithText: Narrated Salim: From his father (Ibn 'Umar) that the Prophet (ﷺ) heard 'Umar saying: "By my father, By my father!" So he said: "Verily Allah prohibits you from swearing by your father." So 'Umar said: "By Allah I did not swear by him after that, neither intentionally nor in narrating."
comments:
[He said:] There are narrations on this topic from Thabit bin Ad-Dahhak, Ibn 'Abbas, Abu Hurairah, Qutailah, and 'Abdur-Rahman bin Samurah. This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

[Abu 'Eisa said:] Abu 'Ubaid said: "The meaning of his saying: 'Nor in narrating' is as if he said: 'I do not narrate it from others' or saying: 'I do not mention it from others.'"

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related About It being Disliked To Swear By Other Than Allah
hadithText: Narrated Ibn 'Umar: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) came across 'Umar while he was on his mount, and he was swearing by his father. So the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Verily Allah prohibits you from swearing by your fathers. So let the one who swears, swear by Allah, or be silent."
comments: [Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related About 'Whoever Swears By Other Than Allah, He Has Committed Shirk'
hadithText: Narrated Sa'd bin 'Ubaidah: That Ibn 'Umar heard a man saying: "No by the Ka'bah" so Ibn 'Umar said: "Nothing is sworn by other than Allah, for I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) say: 'Whoever swears by other than Allah, he has committed disbelief or shirk.'"
comments:
[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan.

According to some of the people of knowledge, the explanation of this Hadith is that his saying: "He has committed disbelief or Shirk" is to demonstrate its severity. The proof for that is the Hadith of Ibn 'Umar: That the Prophet (saws) heard 'Umar saying: 'By my father! By my father!' So he (saws) said: "Verily Allah prohibits you from swearing by your fathers." As well as the Hadith of Abu Hurairah from the Prophet (saws) that he (saws) said: "Whoever says in his oath: 'By Al-Lat, By Al-'Uzza!' Then let him say: 'La Ilaha IllAllah'."

[Abu 'Eisa said:] This is similar to what has been reported from the Prophet (saw) saying: "Indeed Riya' is Shirk."

Some of the people of knowledge explained this Ayah: So whoever hopes in meeting his Lord , then let him work righteous deeds (18:110) and they said it means: "Do not commit Riya'."

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has been Related About One Who Takes An Oath To Walk And He Is Not Able To
hadithText: Narrated Anas: "A Woman vowed to walk to the House of Allah, so the Prophet (ﷺ) asked about that, and he said: 'Verily Allah is in no need of her walking, order her to ride.'"
comments:
[He said:] There are narrations on this topic from Abu Hurairah, 'Uqbah bin 'Amir and Ibn 'Abbas.

[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Anas is a Hasan Sahih Gharib Hadith from this route.

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has been Related About One Who Takes An Oath To Walk And He Is Not Able To
hadithText: Narrated Anas: "The Prophet (ﷺ) passed by old man walking (while supported) between his two sons, so he said: 'What is the matter with this one?' They said: "O Messenger of Allah! He vowed to walk.' He said: 'Verily Allah [the Mighty and Sublime] is in no need of this person punishing himself.'" He said: "So he ordered him to ride."

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has been Related About One Who Takes An Oath To Walk And He Is Not Able To
hadithText: Another Chain from Anas that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saw a man, and he mentioned similarly.
comments: This Hadith is Sahih, and this is acted upon according to some of the people of knowledge. They say that when a woman vows to walk, she is to ride and offer a sheep as Hadi (sacrifice as atonement)

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: About Vows Being Disliked
hadithText: Narrated Abu Hurairah: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Do not vow, for the vows does not prevent what is decreed at all, and it only causes the miser to spend (of his wealth)."
comments:
[He said:] There is something about this from Ibn 'Umar.

[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Abu Hurairah is a Hasan Sahih Hadith. This is acted upon according to some of the people of knowledge among the Companions of the Prophet (saws) and others, they disliked vows. 'Abdullah bin Al-Mubarak said: "It is disliked to make vows related to obedience and disobedience. So if he vows to do some obedience and fulfills it, then he will get a reward, while it was disliked for him to make a vow."

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related About Fulfilling Vows
hadithText: Narrated 'Umar: "I said:'O Messenger of Allah! I had vowed to perform I'tikaf in Al-Masjid Al-Haram for a night during the era of Jahiliyyah.' He said: 'Fulfill your vow.''"
comments:
[He said:] There are narration on this topic from 'Abdullah bin 'Amr, and Ibn 'Abbas.

[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of 'Umar is a Hasan Sahih Hadith. Some of the people of knowledge followed this Hadith. They said that when a man accepts Islam and he had (previously) made a vow to do some act of obedience, then he is obliged to fulfill it.

Some of the people of knowledge among the Companions of the Prophet (saws), and others, said that there is no I'tikaf without fasting. Others among the people of knowledge said that it is not required for the person performing I'tikaf to fast, unless he made fasting obligatory upon himself. They used the Hadith of 'Umar as proof, in which he vowed during Jahiliyyah to perform I'tikaf for a night, and the Prophet (saws) ordered him to fulfill it. This is the view of Ahmad and Ishaq.

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related About How The Prophet (saws) Would Swear
hadithText: Narrated Salim bin 'Abdullah: From this father (Ibn Umar) who said: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) often would swear with this oath: 'No! By the Changer of the Hearts.'"
comments: [Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related About The Reward For Freeing A Slave
hadithText: Narrated Abu Hurairah: "I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying: 'Whoever frees a believing slave, then Allah frees a limb from the Fire for each of his limbs, such that he frees his private parts in lieu of his private parts.'"
comments:
[He said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Aishah, 'Amr bin 'Abasah, Ibn 'Abbas, Wathilah bin Al-Ashqa', Abu Umamah, 'Uqbah bin 'Amir, [and Ka'b bin Murrah].

[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Abu Hurairah is a Hasan Sahih Gharib Hadith from this route. Ibn Al-Had's (a narrator in the chain of this Hadith) name is Yazid bin 'Abdullah bin Usamah bin Al-Had, from Al-Madinah, and he is trustworthy. Malik bin Anas and more than one of the people of knowledge reported from him.

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Slaps His Servant
hadithText: Narrated Suwaid bin Muqarrin Al-Muzani: "We were seven brothers without a servant except one, and one of us slapped her, so the Prophet (ﷺ) ordered us to free her."
comments:
[He said:] There is something on this topic from Ibn 'Umar.

[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

This Hadith has been reported by more than one from Husain bin 'Abdur-Rahman by others, and some of them mentioned in it: "Slapped her on her face."

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Swear By A Religion Other Than Islam
hadithText: Narrated Thabit bin Adh-Dahhak: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever swears by a religion other than Islam while lying, then he is as he said."
comments:
[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

The people of knowledge differed about this: When a man swears by a religion other than Islam, saying he is a Jew or Christian if he were to do this or that. Then he does that thing. Some of them said that he has committed an atrocity and there is no atonement due from him. This is the view of the people of Al-Madinah, and it is the saying of Malik bin Anas, and Abu 'Ubaid followed this view.

Some of the people of knowledge among the Companions of the Prophet (saws), the Tabi'un, as wel as others, said that he has to atone for that. This is the view od Sufyan, Ahmad and Ishaq.

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related About One Who Vows To Perform Hajj By Walking
hadithText: Narrated 'Uqbah bin 'Amir: "I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! My sister vowed that she would walk to the House barefoot and without Khimar (covering).' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Verily Allah will not do anything with the misery of your sister. She should ride, and cover, and fast three days.'"
comments:
[He said:] There is something on this topic from Ibn 'Abbas.

[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan. This is acted upon according to the people of knowledge, and it is the view of Ahmad and Ishaq.

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: The Mention Of What Eliminates Swearing By Al-Lat and Al-'Uza
hadithText: Narrated Abu Hurairah: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever among you swears, saying in his oath: 'By Al-Lat! By Al-'Uzza!' Then let him say 'La ilaha illa Allah' And whoever says: 'Come let me gamble with you!' Then let him give in charity."
comments: [Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. Abu Al-Mughirah is Al-Khawlani, Al-Himsi, and his name is 'Adbul-Quddus bin Al-Hajjaj

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related About Fulfilling The Vow Of The Deceased
hadithText: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas: That Sa'd bin 'Ubadah asked the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) about a vow that was due from his mother, who died before fulfilling it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Fulfill it for her."
comments: [Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.

bookName: The Book on Vows and Oaths
babName: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Freeing Slaves
hadithText: Abu Umamah, and other than him from the Companions of the Prophet (ﷺ), narrated that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Any Muslim man who frees a Muslim man, then it is his salvation from the Fire - each of his limbs suffices for a limb of himself. And any Muslim man that frees two Muslim women, then are his salvation from the Fire - each of their limbs suffices for a limb of himself. And any Muslim woman that frees a Muslim woman, then she is her salvation from the Fire - each of her limb suffices for a limb of herself."
comments:
[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih Gharib from this route.

[Abu 'Eisa said:] In this Hadith is the proof that freeing males is more virtuous for a man than freeing females, due to the saying of the Messenger of Allah (saws): "Any Muslim man frees a Muslim man, then it is his salvation from the Fire - each of his limbs suffices for a limb of himself." And the Hadith is correct in its routes of transmission.
